channel.title: BBC News - World

item.title: Covid: US opens up to fully vaccinated travellers
item.description: The US rolls back international travel restrictions, answering a major demand from allies.

item.title: Hotel Rwanda hero Paul Rusesabagina convicted on terror charges
item.description: A Rwandan court sentences Paul Rusesabagina to 25 years for supporting a terrorist group.

item.title: Gabby Petito: FBI searches fiancé Brian Laundrie's home
item.description: Police say Brian Laundrie, who vanished earlier this month, is a "person of interest".

item.title: Afghanistan: Fighting off hunger under the Taliban
item.description: For most Afghans staving off starvation is the biggest challenge since the Taliban returned to power.

item.title: Covid: Melbourne construction sites shut after violent vaccine protest
item.description: Construction sites in the Australian city are shut for two weeks after a demonstration against jabs.

item.title: Guinness World Records: Japanese sisters certified world's oldest twins
item.description: Umeno Sumiyama and Koume Kodama from Japan receive their Guinness World Records awards.

item.title: Twitch hate raids: Minority streamers have 'a target on their back'
item.description: Streamers tell Newsbeat about the targeted hate they get and what they want Twitch to do about it.

item.title: Cambodia: The autistic teenager jailed over a Telegram post
item.description: He allegedly insulted Cambodia's government, prompting heavily-armed policemen to surround his home.

item.title: Endangered South African penguins killed by swarm of bees near Cape Town
item.description: More than 60 protected birds were found on the beach with multiple bee-stings but no other injuries.

item.title: Canary Islands: Lava from erupting volcano destroys homes
item.description: The volcano on La Palma continues to spew lava after 5,500 were evacuated from villages in its path.

item.title: France's Emmanuel Macron heckled asking Algerian veterans for forgiveness
item.description: The French president is heckled as he promises reparations for Algerians who fought for France.

item.title: Gabby Petito: What do we know about the case so far?
item.description: A body matching Gabby Petito's description was found on Sunday, while her fiancé remains missing.

item.title: Paul Rusesabagina: From Hotel Rwanda hero to convicted terrorist
item.description: Paul Rusesabagina, who was portrayed in Hotel Rwanda, has gone from national hero to enemy of the state.

item.title: My dad, held hostage in Iran
item.description: London-based baker Elika Ashoori is campaigning to bring her father home from jail in Iran.

item.title: Giving birth under the Taliban
item.description: Pregnant women, new mothers and infants are bearing the brunt of a worsening healthcare crisis.

item.title: Canada election: What you need to know about the campaign
item.description: Canadians are voting on Monday and Justin Trudeau's party faces a stiff challenge to retain power.

item.title: South African whistle-blower: I don't feel safe
item.description: Mosilo Mothepu has paid a heavy price for speaking out about corruption in her firm.

item.title: US-UK-Australia pact delivers France some hard truths
item.description: The BBC's Hugh Schofield assesses the harsh realities for France after Australia's US-UK deal.

item.title: Can apps manage our chronic health conditions?
item.description: A Swedish tech firm has created an app to help alleviate people's joint pain.

item.title: A year in Calais: One migrant’s year-long attempt to cross the Channel
item.description: The BBC followed Iranian migrant Alex, as he tried to cross from France to the UK with a smuggler.

item.title: La Palma volcano: Lava destroys homes in the Canary Islands
item.description: A volcanic eruption on the Spanish island of La Palma has demolished homes and caused evacuations.

item.title: Fauci looks to boost vaccines as US infections rise
item.description: The US daily death toll from Covid-19 has risen above 2,000 for the first time since February.

item.title: Street dreams of Nairobi dance crew hoping to beat the odds
item.description: A group of street dancers in Nairobi, Kenya, struggle against the odds to become celebrities.

item.title: My husband and son fought in Afghanistan - it changed all of us
item.description: America's two decades in Afghanistan impacted those who served - and the families waiting at home.
